title.narrative: PMA2020 Abortion Data Collection Activities in Ghana

description.narrative: Collaboration between The Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (JHSPH) and The Guttmacher Institute on abortion measurement activities in Ghana.

activity-date.narrative: The Department of Community Health, School of Medical Sciences at Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST) will implement the Guttmacher Institute abortion measurement activities in Ghana with technical assistance provided by PMA2020 personnel at the Bill and Melinda Gates Institute for Population and Reproductive Health at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (JHSPH).
The Guttmacher Institute will lead the development of the study design and data collection tools and will coordinate the analyses and dissemination events.

mailing-address.narrative: PERFORMANCE MONITORING AND ACCOUNTABILITY 2020 (PMA2020) Bill & Melinda Gates Institute for Population and Reproductive Health Department of Population, Family and Reproductive Health Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health 615 N. Wolfe St. W4513 Baltimore, MD 21205

recipient-country.narrative: The Department of Community Health, School of Medical Sciences at Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST) will implement the Guttmacher Institute abortion measurement activities in Ghana with technical assistance provided by PMA2020 personnel at the Bill and Melinda Gates Institute for Population and Reproductive Health at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (JHSPH). KNUST and PMA2020 will lead the data collection efforts, including the associated trainings, and will coordinate data management with contribution to data analysis and dissemination activities. The Guttmacher Institute will lead the development of the study design and data collection tools and will coordinate the analyses and dissemination events.

description.narrative: The contract between the Guttmacher Institute and JHSPH covers technical assistance from PMA2020 faculty and staff to contribute to development of the data collection instruments, implementation of the data collection, and dissemination of the outputs from data collection.
